9.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, focusing on various screenings and counseling services. The plan includes breastfeeding support, supplies, and counseling, which are provided in conjunction with each birth. This service covers interventions during pregnancy and after birth, including costs for renting breastfeeding equipment.

Cervical cancer screening is offered once every three plan years for women aged 21 to 65, while a combination of cytology and HPV testing is available once every five plan years for women aged 30 to 65. Chlamydia screening is provided annually for sexually active women aged 24 and younger, as well as older women at increased risk of infection. Colorectal cancer screening is available once every five plan years, starting at age 50 and continuing until age 75, with benefits for a colonoscopy if initial home test results are positive.

Contraceptive methods and counseling are covered as prescribed, including FDA-approved contraceptive methods and patient education for all women with reproductive capacity. Dental caries prevention for infants and children up to age 5 is provided annually, including fluoride varnish application and fluoride supplementation. Depression screening is available annually for the general adult population, including pregnant and postpartum women, with a focus on accurate diagnosis and effective treatment.

Diabetes screening is offered annually for adults aged 40 to 70 who are overweight or obese, with referrals for intensive behavioral counseling if needed. Fall prevention for older adults is provided annually for those aged 65 and older at increased risk for falls. Folic acid supplementation is covered as prescribed for women planning or capable of pregnancy. Gestational diabetes mellitus screening is available annually for asymptomatic pregnant women after 24 weeks of gestation.

10.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of the preventative health services covered under the MEC plan, focusing on various screenings and counseling services. The plan includes Gonorrhea Prophylactic Medication, which is prescribed for newborns to prevent gonococcal ophthalmia neonatorum. Gonorrhea Screening is available once per plan year for sexually active women aged 24 years or younger and older women at increased risk. Healthy Diet and Physical Activity Counseling is offered annually for adults who are overweight or obese with additional cardiovascular disease risk factors, aiming to promote a healthful diet and physical activity.

Hemoglobinopathies Screening is provided once per plan year for sickle cell disease in newborns. Hepatitis B and C screenings are available annually for high-risk individuals, including pregnant women and adults born between 1945 and 1965. High Blood Pressure Screening is offered once per plan year for adults aged 18 or older. HIV Preexposure Prophylaxis is prescribed for individuals at high risk of HIV acquisition, while HIV Screening is available annually for adolescents and adults aged 15 to 65 years, including pregnant women.

Additional services include Hypothyroidism Screening for newborns, Intimate Partner Violence Screening for women of reproductive age, and Lung Cancer Screening for adults aged 55 to 80 years with a significant smoking history. Obesity Screening and Counseling are provided annually for children, adolescents, and adults with a BMI of 30 kg/m2 or higher. Osteoporosis Screening is available for women aged 65 and older, and Phenylketonuria Screening is conducted for newborns.

11.summary:
This document outlines the preventive health services covered under the MEC plan, detailing various screenings and counseling services available to plan members. The plan includes preeclampsia screening once per plan year for pregnant women with high blood pressure measurements throughout pregnancy. Rh incompatibility screening is provided during the first pregnancy visit and again between 24-28 weeks' gestation for unsensitized Rh (D)-negative women, unless the biological father is known to be Rh (D)-negative.

Sexually transmitted infections counseling is available once per plan year for sexually active adolescents and adults at increased risk. Skin cancer behavioral counseling is offered annually to young adults, adolescents, children, and parents of young children to minimize ultraviolet radiation exposure. Statin preventive medication is prescribed for adults without a history of cardiovascular disease but with risk factors, following specific criteria.

Syphilis screening is provided annually for non-pregnant persons at increased risk and all pregnant women. Tobacco use counseling and interventions are available twice per plan year, offering behavioral interventions and FDA-approved pharmacotherapy for adults and pregnant women who use tobacco. Tuberculosis screening is conducted annually for populations at risk. Vision screening is available once every two plan years for children aged 3 to 5 years. Well-woman visits and well-child visits are provided annually, focusing on age-appropriate preventive services and prenatal care.

12.summary:
This document provides a detailed summary of benefits related to immunizations under the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. It outlines the recommended vaccinations for children from birth through eighteen years old, as advised by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. The document is divided into two main sections based on age groups: Birth through Six Years Old and Children from Seven through Eighteen Years Old.

For children from birth through six years old, the document lists several vaccines including Hepatitis B, Diphtheria, Tetanus, and Acellular Pertussis (DTap), Haemophilus Influenzae Type B (Hib), Pneumococcal 13-valent Conjugate (PCV13), Inactivated Poliovirus (IPV), Influenza (yearly), Measles, Mumps, and Rubella (MMR), Varicella, Hepatitis A, and Rotavirus. Each vaccine is accompanied by specific age requirements and limitations, such as the recommended age range for administration and any specific conditions or intervals between doses.

For children from seven through eighteen years old, the document includes vaccines such as Influenza (yearly), Tetanus, Diphtheria, and Acellular Pertussis (Tdap), Human Papillomavirus (HPV), and Meningococcal Serogroups A, C, W, Y. The document specifies age requirements and limitations for each vaccine, including the recommended age for administration and any special notes, such as the need for a 3-shot series of the HPV vaccine for certain individuals.

The document emphasizes the importance of adhering to the recommended immunization schedule to ensure optimal health outcomes for children and adolescents.

1.summary:
The Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans offer a variety of options tailored to meet diverse healthcare needs. There are six distinct plans available: Reliant Care Wellness, Reliant Care 1, Reliant Care 2, Reliant Care 3, Reliant Care 4, and Reliant Care 5. Each plan is designed to provide specific benefits and coverage levels, allowing individuals to select the plan that best aligns with their healthcare requirements and financial considerations.

The Reliant Care Wellness plan focuses on preventive care and wellness benefits, encouraging proactive health management. The other plans, Reliant Care 1 through Reliant Care 5, likely offer varying degrees of coverage, potentially including hospital stays, outpatient services, and prescription drug benefits. These plans may differ in terms of premium costs, deductibles, and out-of-pocket maximums, providing flexibility for different budgetary needs.

While the document does not provide detailed coverage limits or cost structures, it highlights the availability of multiple plans, suggesting a tiered approach to healthcare coverage. This allows individuals to choose a plan that offers the right balance of benefits and costs, tailored to their personal health and financial situation.

2.summary:
The Reliant Care Wellness plan provides specific benefits focused on physician services and telemedicine. Under physician services, the plan allows for one wellness exam per year with a co-pay of $25 and a maximum coverage of $150 per visit. This service utilizes the First Health Network and is limited to in-network providers only. Telemedicine services are offered through Kindly Human and Recuro Health, with no consult fee and no maximum limit on usage. Additionally, the plan includes access to discount prescriptions through participating pharmacies only, facilitated by BestChoice RX.

The plan is sponsored by Vitaminpatch and administered by Merchants Benefit Admin. It is important to note that all sickness benefits are subject to a 30-day waiting period before they become payable. The plan is primarily designed to cover preventive and wellness services as mandated by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. It does not cover services unless explicitly listed in the Schedule of Benefits, emphasizing the need to review the list carefully. The plan description includes details on copays, deductibles, and limitations, ensuring that members are aware of the specific terms and conditions.

3.summary:
The Reliant Care 1 plan offers a structured set of benefits focusing on physician services, telemedicine, and advocacy. Under physician services, the plan allows for three primary care office visits per year with a co-pay of $25 and a maximum charge of $150 per visit. Additionally, it includes one specialist or urgent care office visit annually, with a co-pay of $50 and a maximum of $300 per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits are provided at $1,000 per day, with a yearly maximum of $5,000. However, there is a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion for hospitalization benefits.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum limit, enhancing accessibility to healthcare professionals. The plan also includes a discount prescription program available through participating pharmacies. Advocacy services are provided through a hospital bill reducer, assisting members in managing hospital expenses.

The plan has specific limitations and exclusions. All sickness benefits are subject to a 30-day waiting period before they become payable. Outpatient physician services and wellness benefits require in-network providers, while inpatient hospital indemnity benefits do not. The plan does not cover services outside the listed Schedule of Benefits, emphasizing the importance of reviewing the list carefully. It is designed to cover preventive and wellness services as mandated by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act, with detailed information on copays, deductibles, and limitations available in the Summary Plan Description.

4.summary:
The Reliant Care 2 plan offers a structured set of benefits focusing on physician services, telemedicine, and prescription coverage. Under physician services, members are entitled to four primary care office visits per year with a $25 copay and a maximum of $150 per visit. Specialist or urgent care visits are limited to two per year, with a $50 copay and a $300 maximum per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, capped at $10,000 annually, with a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion period.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum usage limit, enhancing accessibility to healthcare professionals. Prescription benefits include preventative and acute prescriptions, subject to a formulary but not a monthly maximum. Pharmacy retail options allow for up to a 30-day supply with member payments, offering generic drugs at a $0 copay. Additionally, a 90-day mail-order supply is available for 200 generic maintenance drugs with a $5 copay for preferred generics.

The plan includes a hospital bill reducer feature and is supported by advocacy services. Limitations include a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and restrictions on outpatient services to in-network providers. Hospitalization benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions within the first 12 months. Specialty drugs are excluded, but a prescription assistance program is available. Members must review the Schedule of Benefits for detailed coverage information.

5.summary:
The Reliant Care 3 plan offers a structured set of benefits focusing on physician services, telemedicine, and prescription coverage. Members are entitled to four primary care office visits per year with a $25 co-pay and a maximum charge of $150 per visit. Specialist or urgent care visits are also limited to four per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits are provided at $1,000 per day, with a yearly maximum of $15,000, subject to a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion period.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum usage limit, enhancing accessibility to healthcare services. Prescription benefits include preventive and acute prescriptions, with generic drugs available at a $0 copay for a 30-day supply. Preferred generics have a $5 copay, while non-preferred generics and brand drugs require member payment, with specific retail and mail-order copay structures.

The plan includes several limitations and conditions. All sickness benefits are subject to a 30-day waiting period before they become payable. Hospitalization benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions within the first 12 months of coverage. The plan does not cover services not listed in the Schedule of Benefits, and specialty drugs are excluded from coverage. Members are encouraged to review the Schedule of Benefits for detailed information on covered services, copays, deductibles, and limitations.

6.summary:
The Reliant Care 4 plan offers a range of healthcare services with specific visit limits and co-pays. Physician services include one wellness exam per year with a $25 co-pay and a maximum of $150 per visit. Primary care office visits are limited to four per year with a $50 co-pay, while specialist or urgent care visits also have a four-visit limit with a $75 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day with a $10,000 annual maximum, subject to a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion. In/outpatient surgery is covered up to $1,000 per year with a $2,000 annual maximum, also subject to the pre-existing condition clause. Emergency room visits, if admitted, incur a $1,000 per incident charge, and ambulance services, if admitted, are $500 per incident, both with the same pre-existing condition exclusion.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum limit. Pharmacy benefits include a 30-day supply of acute and preventive generic prescriptions with member payments, and a 90-day supply for maintenance drugs. Non-preferred generics and brand drugs require member payments, with specific co-pays for mail orders. Prescription terms specify that non-preventive maintenance prescriptions have a $150 benefit limit per person per month, and specialty drugs are not covered. The plan includes a prescription assistance program for qualifying members.

The plan has several limitations, including a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and restrictions to in-network providers for outpatient services. Hospitalization benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions within the first 12 months. The plan does not cover services unless listed in the Schedule of Benefits, and it is limited to preventive and wellness services as required by law.

7.summary:
The Reliant Care 5 plan offers a range of healthcare services with specific visit limits and co-pay amounts. For physician services, the plan includes one wellness exam per year with a $25 co-pay and a maximum of $150 per visit. Primary care office visits are covered for up to five visits per year with a $50 co-pay and a $150 maximum per visit. Specialist or urgent care office visits are also limited to five visits per year, with a $75 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit. In-patient hospitalization benefits are provided at $1,500 per day, with a yearly maximum of $15,000, and a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion applies. In/outpatient surgery is covered at $1,500 per year, with a $4,500 yearly maximum and the same pre-existing condition exclusion. Emergency room visits, if admitted, incur a $1,000 per incident charge, and ambulance benefits are $500 per incident, both subject to the 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion.

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and no maximum limit. The plan includes pharmacy benefits for up to a 30-day supply of acute and preventive generic prescriptions, with member payments required. Non-preferred generics and brand drugs require prior authorization, with specific co-pay amounts for retail and mail-order options. Prescription terms and conditions specify that non-preventive maintenance prescriptions are subject to a $150 benefit limit per person per month, and specialty drugs are not covered. The plan also offers a prescription assistance program for members who qualify.

The plan includes several limitations and exclusions. All sickness benefits are subject to a 30-day waiting period before benefits are payable. Outpatient physician services and wellness benefits are limited to in-network providers, while inpatient hospital indemnity benefits are not. Hospitalization benefits are not payable for pre-existing conditions as defined in the plan's terms for the first 12 months of coverage. The plan does not cover services unless listed in the Schedule of Benefits, and it is limited to preventive and wellness services as required by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

8.summary:
This document outlines the preventive health services covered under the MEC/Preventative Health Services plan. Benefits are automatically subject to specific federal regulations, and any amendments are incorporated by reference. The preventive services include medical services rated 'A' or 'B' by the United States Preventive Services Task Force, preventive care for infants, children, and adolescents, and immunizations recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices.

The plan covers a variety of screenings and preventive medications. Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Screening is available once per lifetime for men aged 65-75 who have smoked. An Adult Annual Standard Physical is covered once per plan year for adults. Alcohol misuse screening and counseling are provided annually for adults 18 years or older. Aspirin is prescribed for adults aged 50 to 59 at risk of cardiovascular diseases. Bacteriuria Screening is available annually for pregnant women. BRCA Risk Assessment and Genetic Counseling/Testing are covered annually for women with a family history of certain cancers. Breast Cancer Preventive Medications are prescribed for women at increased risk. Breast Cancer Screening is available once every two years for women aged 50 and older, limited to 2D mammograms.

The document specifies that none of the preventive health services are covered if provided at a hospital.

presentation.content:
**Cover (1 slide)**
- **Plan Name:** Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans
- **Tagline:** "Tailored Healthcare Solutions for Every Need"

**Plan Overview (1 slide)**
- **Target Audience:** Individuals and Families
- **Offerings:** A range of healthcare options focusing on wellness, preventive care, and affordability.
- **Key Benefits:** Accessibility to healthcare services, personalized plan options, and financial flexibility.

**Core Plan Elements (2-3 slides)**
- **Coverage Areas:** Physician services, hospitalization, virtual visits.
- **Plan Structure:** Tiered options with varying co-pays and visit limits.
- **Eligibility:** Designed for individuals and families with a focus on affordability.

**Common Service Features (2-3 slides)**
- **Provider Networks:** Access to in-network providers for optimal care.
- **Claims Management:** Efficient processing and support for claims.
- **Support Tools:** Wellness programs, advocacy services, and user-friendly dashboards.

**Plan Tiers Breakdown (8-12 slides)**

- **Reliant Care Wellness Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** One wellness exam per year, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Telemedicine:** Unlimited access with no consult fee.
  - **Prescriptions:** Discounted prescriptions through BestChoice RX.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

- **Reliant Care 1 Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** Three primary care visits, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Hospitalization:** $1,000 per day, $5,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - **Telemedicine:** Unlimited access with no consult fee.
  - **Advocacy:** Hospital bill reducer.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

- **Reliant Care 2 Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** Four primary care visits, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Hospitalization:** $1,000 per day, $10,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - **Prescriptions:** Generic drugs at $0 co-pay, preferred generics at $5.
  - **Advocacy:** Hospital bill reducer.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

- **Reliant Care 3 Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** Four primary care visits, $25 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Hospitalization:** $1,000 per day, $15,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - **Prescriptions:** Generic drugs at $0 co-pay, preferred generics at $5.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

- **Reliant Care 4 Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** Four primary care visits, $50 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Hospitalization:** $1,000 per day, $10,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - **Surgery:** $1,000 per year, $2,000 annual max.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

- **Reliant Care 5 Plan**
  - **Physician Services:** Five primary care visits, $50 co-pay, $150 max per visit.
  - **Hospitalization:** $1,500 per day, $15,000 annual max, 12-month pre-existing exclusion.
  - **Surgery:** $1,500 per year, $4,500 annual max.
  - **Limitations:** 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits.

**Comparison Slides (Markdown Table)**

| Plan Tier          | Primary Care Visits | Specialist Visits | Hospitalization | Surgery Coverage | Prescription Co-pay | Telemedicine | Advocacy Services |
|--------------------|---------------------|-------------------|-----------------|------------------|---------------------|--------------|-------------------|
| Wellness           | 1 per year          | N/A               | N/A             | N/A              | Discounts only      | Unlimited    | N/A               |
| Reliant Care 1     | 3 per year          | 1 per year        | $5,000 max      | N/A              | Discounts only      | Unlimited    | Bill Reducer      |
| Reliant Care 2     | 4 per year          | 2 per year        | $10,000 max     | N/A              | $0/$5 generics      | Unlimited    | Bill Reducer      |
| Reliant Care 3     | 4 per year          | 4 per year        | $15,000 max     | N/A              | $0/$5 generics      | Unlimited    | N/A               |
| Reliant Care 4     | 4 per year          | 4 per year        | $10,000 max     | $2,000 max       | $0/$5 generics      | Unlimited    | N/A               |
| Reliant Care 5     | 5 per year          | 5 per year        | $15,000 max     | $4,500 max       | $0/$5 generics      | Unlimited    | N/A               |

**Limitations and Exclusions (1-2 slides)**
- **Exclusions:** Pre-existing conditions, waiting periods, specialty drug exclusions.
- **Limitations:** In-network provider requirements, specific visit limits.

**Key Takeaways and Action Steps (1 slide)**
- **Flexibility:** Multiple plan options to suit diverse needs.
- **Balance:** Cost-effective solutions with essential coverage.
- **Next Steps:** Enrollment details and support contact information.

**Thank You (1 slide)**
- **Message:** "Thank you for considering Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans. Your health, our priority."

script.content:
---- Cover ----

Hello, everyone! Thank you for joining today's session on the Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans. We'll walk through these plans' tailored healthcare solutions, designed to meet every need. Let's get started!

---- Plan Overview ----

The Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans offer six distinct options.

These plans emphasize preventive care to help you manage your health proactively.

They include physician services and telemedicine benefits to ensure you have access to care when you need it.

Prescription coverage is available through BestChoice RX, providing financial relief on medications.

Additionally, advocacy services are included to support you in navigating healthcare challenges.

Now, let's explore the key features and benefits of these plans.

---- Key Features and Benefits ----

The Reliant Care plans prioritize preventive care and wellness, ensuring you stay healthy and informed.

Physician services are a core component, providing access to necessary medical care.

Telemedicine services offer the convenience of virtual visits with no consult fee.

Prescription coverage varies by plan, allowing you to choose the best fit for your needs.

Advocacy services are available through MyHealthcare NINJA, offering support and guidance.

Let's move on to discuss the cost management tools available with these plans.

---- Cost Management Tools ----

The Hospital Bill Reducer, or HBR, is a key tool for managing healthcare costs.

The Prescription Assistance Program helps reduce the financial burden of medications.

Telemedicine support ensures you have access to care without additional costs.

Next, we'll look at how the Hospital Bill Reducer works.

---- How Hospital Bill Reducer Works ----

To use the Hospital Bill Reducer, first enroll through Reliant Care.

Submit your hospital bills for review by the advocacy team.

Once reviewed, you'll receive HBR documentation.

The team will then negotiate bill reductions on your behalf.

This process helps reduce your financial burden significantly.

Now, let's discuss preventive care and wellness.

---- Preventive Care and Wellness ----

Annual wellness exams are included to keep you on track with your health.

Screening programs are available for early detection of potential health issues.

Vitaminpatch provides additional wellness support to enhance your health journey.

Let's explore the telehealth services offered by Reliant Care.

---- Telehealth Services ----

Telemedicine services come with no consult fee, making them accessible to all.

You have unlimited access to these services, ensuring care is always available.

The 24/7 availability means you can receive care whenever you need it.

This offers convenient access to healthcare from the comfort of your home.

Now, let's look at the advocacy and support services provided.

---- Advocacy and Support Services ----

Reliant Care offers extensive healthcare advocacy to assist you.

Bill reduction assistance is available to help manage hospital expenses.

Prescription assistance options provide financial relief on medications.

Support services are in place to ensure members receive the help they need.

Let's examine the Reliant Care Wellness Plan in more detail.

---- Reliant Care Wellness Plan (One of Two) ----

The Wellness Plan focuses on preventive care, including an annual wellness exam.

Telemedicine access is unlimited, with no consult fee.

Discounted prescriptions are available through participating pharmacies.

This plan is sponsored by Vitaminpatch, enhancing your wellness journey.

Physician services are in-network only, with a $25 co-pay per visit.

Let's continue with more details on the Wellness Plan.

---- Reliant Care Wellness Plan (Two of Two) ----

Prescription coverage is offered through a discount program at participating pharmacies.

There is a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits, focusing on preventive services only.

Now, let's look at the Reliant Care 1 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 1 Plan (One of Two) ----

The Reliant Care 1 Plan includes three primary care visits per year.

Each visit has a $25 co-pay, with a maximum of $150 per visit.

Specialist visits are limited to one per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

Hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, with a $5,000 annual maximum.

There is a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion.

Let's continue with more details on the Reliant Care 1 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 1 Plan (Two of Two) ----

Telemedicine services are available with no consult fee and unlimited access.

Advocacy services include a hospital bill reducer and prescription discounts.

Now, let's explore the Reliant Care 2 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 2 Plan (One of Two) ----

The Reliant Care 2 Plan offers four primary care visits per year.

Each visit has a $25 co-pay, with a maximum of $150 per visit.

Specialist visits are limited to two per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

Hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, with a $10,000 annual maximum.

There is a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion.

Let's continue with more details on the Reliant Care 2 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 2 Plan (Two of Two) ----

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications, with generic drugs at a $0 copay.

Advocacy services include a hospital bill reducer and prescription assistance.

Now, let's examine the Reliant Care 3 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 3 Plan (One of Two) ----

The Reliant Care 3 Plan includes four primary care visits per year.

Each visit has a $25 co-pay, with a maximum of $150 per visit.

Specialist visits are limited to four per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

Hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, with a $15,000 annual maximum.

There is a 12-month pre-existing condition exclusion.

Let's continue with more details on the Reliant Care 3 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 3 Plan (Two of Two) ----

Prescription coverage includes preventive and acute medications, with generic drugs at a $0 copay.

Advocacy services include a hospital bill reducer and prescription assistance.

Now, let's look at the Reliant Care 4 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 4 Plan (One of Two) ----

The Reliant Care 4 Plan offers one wellness exam per year.

Primary care visits are limited to four per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $150 maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are limited to four per year, with a $75 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

Let's continue with more details on the Reliant Care 4 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 4 Plan (Two of Two) ----

Hospitalization benefits provide $1,000 per day, with a $10,000 annual maximum.

Surgery and emergency room coverage include $1,000 per year for surgery and $1,000 per incident for ER visits.

Now, let's explore the Reliant Care 5 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 5 Plan (One of Two) ----

The Reliant Care 5 Plan includes one wellness exam per year.

Primary care visits are limited to five per year, with a $50 co-pay and a $150 maximum per visit.

Specialist visits are limited to five per year, with a $75 co-pay and a $300 maximum per visit.

Let's continue with more details on the Reliant Care 5 Plan.

---- Reliant Care 5 Plan (Two of Two) ----

Hospitalization benefits provide $1,500 per day, with a $15,000 annual maximum.

Surgery and emergency room coverage include $1,500 per year for surgery and $1,000 per incident for ER visits.

Now, let's compare the different plan tiers available.

---- Comparing Plan Tiers ----

The Reliant Care Wellness Plan offers one primary care visit per year, while the Reliant Care 5 Plan offers five.

Specialist visits range from none in the Wellness Plan to five in the Reliant Care 5 Plan.

Hospitalization benefits vary, with the Wellness Plan offering none and the Reliant Care 5 Plan offering a $15,000 annual maximum.

Telemedicine services are unlimited across all plans.

Prescription coverage ranges from discounts in the Wellness Plan to $0 copay for generics in higher tiers.

Let's review important definitions and limitations.

---- Definitions and Limitations ----

Preventive care is limited to listed services and requires in-network providers, with a 30-day waiting period.

Hospitalization benefits have a 12-month waiting period for pre-existing conditions.

Prescription coverage is limited to generic drugs, with specialty drugs excluded.

Advocacy services include a hospital bill reducer and prescription assistance.

Here are the key points to remember.

---- Key Takeaways and Reminders ----

The Reliant Care plans offer significant preventive care benefits.

Telemedicine services are included across all plans.

Prescription discounts provide financial relief on medications.

In-network providers are required for all services.

Thank you for your time today. We hope this information helps you make informed decisions about your health coverage. Continue to be great!

---- Closing ----

Thank you for considering Reliant Care Health Insurance Plans. Your health is our priority. Continue to be great!

## Comparing the Plans

| **Feature** | **Reliant Care Wellness** | **Reliant Care 1** | **Reliant Care 2** | **Reliant Care 3** | **Reliant Care 4** | **Reliant Care 5** |
|---------|----------|----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|-----------|
| Primary Care Visits | 1 visit/year | 3 visits/year | 4 visits/year | 4 visits/year | 4 visits/year | 5 visits/year |
| Specialist Visits | N/A | 1 visit/year | 2 visits/year | 4 visits/year | 4 visits/year | 5 visits/year |
| Hospitalization | N/A | $5,000/year max | $10,000/year max | $15,000/year max | $10,000/year max | $15,000/year max |
| Telemedicine | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited | Unlimited |
| Prescription Coverage | Discounts | Discounts | Generic $0 copay | Generic $0 copay | Generic $0 copay | Generic $0 copay |

script.content:
The Reliant Care Wellness Plan offers one primary care visit per year, while the Reliant Care 5 Plan offers five.

Specialist visits range from none in the Wellness Plan to five in the Reliant Care 5 Plan.

Hospitalization benefits vary, with the Wellness Plan offering none and the Reliant Care 5 Plan offering a $15,000 annual maximum.

Telemedicine services are unlimited across all plans.

Prescription coverage ranges from discounts in the Wellness Plan to $0 copay for generics in higher tiers.
